justification: The article notes that "Ecological momentary assessment ... [can] study the short-term dynamics that capture parenting as it really happens," directly linking EMA to measuring moment-to-moment parenting behavior.

It states that "Ecological momentary assessment and daily diary designs can ... study the short-term dynamics that capture parenting as it really happens," indicating daily diary methods are used to measure these parenting dynamics.

When discussing laboratory methodologies, the paper suggests "a vignette design in which parents are presented with a series of brief vignettes describing a parenting scenario—here, choosing a curfew—and asked what they would do," implying this experimental vignette measures parents' curfew-related decisions.
